flawed_nl_solution:
After a year, scheme A will yield 30% of his capital which is (30/100)*$300 = $90<<30/100*300=90>>90
In addition to his capital, he will have $90+$300 = $390<<90+300=390>>390 in scheme A
After a year, scheme B will yield 50% of his capital which is (50/100)*$200 = $10<<50*0.01*200=10>>10
In addition to his capital, he will have $10+$200 = $210<<10+200=210>>210 in scheme B
After a year, he will have $390-$210 = $180<<390-210=180>>180 in scheme A more than in scheme B
#### 180

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 100, not 10. It appears a zero was dropped from the number.
